MSG.ShortText: Could not determine size of table $FILENO$
Error while positioning iterator in request file $FILENO$; error $RETURNCODE$
MSG.Description: During the regulation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STASTICS' allocation, a serious error occurred causing the command to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Error while updating record in request file $FILENO$; key $KEYASHEX$; error $RETURNCODE$
MSG.Description: During the regulation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STASTICS' allocation, a serious error occurred causing the command to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Error while deleting current entry in request file $FILENO$; key $KEYASHEX$; error $RETURNCODE$
MSG.Description: During the regulation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STASTICS' allocation, a serious error occurred causing the command to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Out of memory; requested memory in bytes $ALLOC_SIZE$
MSG.Description: A memory allocation of $ALLOC_SIZE$ bytes could not be achieved.

MSG.ShortText: Server tasklist returned unexpected status on wait; list size $SIZE$
MSG.Description: During the computation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement, a serious error occurred causing the statement to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Server job returned an unexpected result code $RETURNCODE$
MSG.Description: During the computation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STASTICS' command, a serious error occurred causing the command to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Object not initialized
MSG.Description: A class and/or an object were used without having been initialized.

MSG.ShortText: Aborting statistics computation due to system error
MSG.Description: During the computation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement, a serious error occurred causing the statement to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Update Stat for table $FILENO$ aborted due to metadata change
MSG.Description:
The 'Update Statistics' command for the table with the file ID $FILENO$ had to abort because the metadata of the table changed during the processing of the command. You can determine the name of the table concerned with the following command:
SELECT * from FILES where FILEID = x'$FILENO$

MSG.ShortText: Error during distinct file creation for table $FILENO$, error = $RETURNCODE$
MSG.Description: During the computation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement, a serious error occurred causing the statement to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Error during locking of table $FILENO$
MSG.Description: During the computation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement, a serious error occurred causing the statement to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Parallel 'Update Statistics' coordinator is processing table $FILENO$ itself
MSG.Description: During the parallel processing of an 'Update Statistics' order, no client task was available for the statistics computation for the table with the file ID $FILENO$. This is why the task which coordinates the processing of all orders computes the statistics for this table itself.

MSG.ShortText: Could not create internal transaction for table $FILENO$
MSG.Description: During the computation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement, a serious error occurred causing the statement to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Job id $JOB_ID$ not in run queue; queue size = $SIZE$
MSG.Description: During the computation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement, a serious error occurred causing the statement to abort.

MSG.ShortText: TableInfo not in job queue for table with fileNo $FILENO$
MSG.Description: During the computation of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement, a serious error occurred causing the statement to abort.

MSG.ShortText: Serializing statistics computation due to resource shortage
MSG.Description: The parallel processing of an 'Update Statistics' statement was changed over to serial processing because the required resources for parallel processing (e.g. free server tasks, main memory or other internal resources) are not available. It is possible that it will be changed over to parallel processing at a later date, when more resources should be available.

MSG.ShortText: Aborting statistics computation due to resource shortage
MSG.Description: The processing of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement was aborted because the required resources for processing (e.g. main memory or other internal resources) are not available.

MSG.ShortText: Could not allocate $ALLOC_SIZE$ bytes, trying to go on
MSG.Description: During the parallel computing of table statistics in the course of an 'UPDATE STATISTICS' statement, a memory allocation could not be completed. It is possible, that the processing of the statement may be aborted on these grounds.

MSG.ShortText: Statistics updated in file directory for '$TITLE$': from $FDIR_PAGE_COUNT$ to $COUNTED_PAGES$
Updated '$TITLE$' from $FDIR_PAGE_COUNT$ to $COUNTED_PAGES$ for root $PAGENO$
Unexpected error during file directory counter collection: $BASIS_ERROR$
MSG.Description: An unexpected error occurred during the initial processing of file directory counter statistics. Error: $BASIS_ERROR$ File ID: $FILENO$

MSG.ShortText: Damaged data record found
MSG.Description:
A serious defect on at least one record on this data page was detected on the data page with the page number '$PAGENO$'. The data page belongs to the database object with the FileID '$FILENO$' and respectively the root ‘$ROOT$'. The defective database object is of type '$FILETYPE$' and has the persistence type '$PERSISTENT_TYPE$'.
From experience, this type of error can be attributed to problems outside of the database software, for example to the IO system, and is not allowed to be ignored.
For a potentially necessary detailed analysis by development support, the defective data page was written into the run directory of the database.
MSG.Action:
Check your hardware, in particular the IO system. If necessary contact your hardware partner.

Make your further procedure dependent on the persistence type of the affected database object.

If it concerns a temporary object on the effected database object, you should nevertheless execute a more in-depth database consistency check right away, although the temporary database object is no longer available after the next database startup at the latest.

In all other cases it can be useful to determine the name of the affected database object with the registered FileID or the registered root and the system tables FILES and respective ROOTS.

  • If an index is affected, it can be deleted and newly created. In addition, execute an in-depth database consistency check as soon as possible.
  • If a table is affected an in-depth consistency check on the effected table can also be executed as an alternative to the in-depth consistency check of the entire database. Under certain circumstances it concerns a transient defect of the previously reported error, which was noted and corrected by a RAID system. Execute a more in-depth database consistency check as soon as possible, even if the defect no longer occurs.
    If the defect continues to exist, check whether you can reconstruct the data, if appropriate with the help of your application. Should this possibility exist, promptly execute an in-depth database consistency check.
  • In all other cases a recover of the entire data area must be executed. The data backup serves as the basis of the restore, which was created before the last successful database consistency check.


    • Note, that a successful data backup (complete or incremental) could contain defective data records, since not every data record is checked during a backup by default.

    Note that up to now other undetected defects in the database could exist.

MSG.ShortText: User defined functions are not supported for packed tables
Range scan on table with FileID '$FILENO$ ' canceled
Check LOB canceled
Illegal field length: $FIELD_LENGTH$; maximum possible length $LENGTH$
Creation of temporary index log file failed due to a failed request for main memory
Creation of a temporary index log file failed; file directory error '$ERRORTEXT$'
Creation of temporary index log file failed during registration of the file; fileId = '$FILENO$'
Drop of a tempory index log file failed; fileId '$FILENO$' was not registered
Error during insert into a temporary index log file
Unexpected file state during index creation; index fileno '$FILENO$'; file state '$STATE$'
Unexpected error during file directory access while working with index; fileNo '$FILENO$'; error '$ERRORTEXT$'
